column1: Blood Clot Prevention Following Percutaneous Coronary Intervention
column2: Joyce, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have had 3 blood clots since 2003. One after heart bypass, one in optic nerve in eye a year ago, and in stent placed in June 2012. So far I have had only one side effect which is that any cuts take a longer time to stop bleeding and healing. Used to take Plavix, but was not working, evidently,  so switched to Effient and hoping to never have another blood clot again.

column9: Extremely tired. I'm doing exercises for my lungs. Since I've had the stent put in and am using the Effient, I can not complete the lenght of time I was doing before using Effient. I'm so tired I can hardly make it in a day. I bruise so bad and still feel the pressure I was having before stent was in. I told the lung doctor about how decreased length of time since I'm on Effient. The cardioloigst seem to just ignore what I am saying. He's not tried to put me on any other medician to even see if it would improve my tirdness and help me in anyway. I'm seriously thinking of changing cardio doctors. When I had a treadmill done he dsaid all was ok. within just under 6 months I was having a stent put in LAD. Someone explain to me why this didn't show up at that time that I had a 90% blockage. I want a different medician that doesn't make me so tired!

column1: Blood Clot Prevention Following Percutaneous Coronary Intervention
column2: HappyinMexico, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had 2 drug-eluting stents put in on 26 September 2010 here in Mexico where I now live. Have been on Effient 10mg and also take 81mg aspirin. Bruising is only side effect. Also have nightmares but don't know if there is any connection to Effient.  I feel much better since having the stents. My cardio used the radial (wrist) method which is much quicker and painless in comparison to through the groin.  About 8 years ago in Canada, I had an angiogram through the groin and the recovery and discomfort was worse.  Effient costs me $1080 Mexican Pesos ($78 Canadian dollars) so it sounds cheaper here than in the U.S.
